data.title: opoponax oil (commiphora erythraea var. glabrescens engle), 8021
data.meta_description: Functional use(s) - flavor and fragrance agents. Has a balsamic type odor and an balsamic type flavor.
data.text:

Useful in brown notes like cocoa, coffee and savory notes like mushrom Preferred Partner Accommodate each customers unique needs. Global Essence was founded in 1993 as a two person operation servicing regional customers in the New York/ New Jersey area. In the twenty years since, it has grown into a multinational operation with offices in the US, UK, and Singapore. These offices allow Global to provide regional support to its customers worldwide. As the world continues become more connected, this approach positions Global to continue to offer the highest quality products and experience to all of its customers. Email:Info US Email:Info Voice:

Blog Press Release News GSC106947103771 GSC106947103771 Product(s): Opoponax Oil Perfumery and Aromatherapy materials since 1979 Hermitage Oils, the true home of essential oils! Hermitage Oils offers a selection of Absolutes, Essential Oils, Natural Isolates, Aroma Chemicals, CO2 Extracts, Ethanol Tinctures, and Extraits by Enfleurage. Email:Info Email:Sales Facebook GSC106947103771 GSC106947103771 Product(s): Opoponax Essential Oil (ETHIOPIA) Mark Evans has this to say about Opoponax Essential Oil (ETHIOPIA) “This Ethiopian opoponax essential oil is created from steam distillation and is a yellow, free flowing liquid. Smelling opoponax oil straight from the bottle will give you a head-rush and probably a headache as it initially has a strong resinous, terpene, paint fume smell and it is this intense aspect which makes it so useful in small amounts as a top-note to brighten any Oriental perfume. Opoponax Essential Oil (SOMALIA) Unlike the absolute oil this material is of a pourable viscosity, amber in colour and produced by steam distilling the resin. In natural perfumery Opoponax is used in chypre, fougere, leather bases, oriental bouquets and heavy-floral perfumes.
